explain: a person who rules on plays in a game; referee
the baseball player who throws the ball to the batter
to stop trying to do something
to make more living things of the same kind
the group of living things that come from the same living thing
a round object with a map of the world on its surface
small white pieces of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather
the sweet part of a plant that you can eat and that holds its seeds
a sticky substance used to join things together
statement: The pitcher threw a fastball and Jackie missed.
Jackie ran to the dugout to join the other players.
Don't give up just because it's difficult.
All living things grow, change, and reproduce.
The mother cat takes care of her offspring.
A frog and a toad are animals that look alike.
Some adults look different to their offspring.
She spun the globe and pointed to the country she wanted to visit.
The children ran outside to play when they saw snow falling from the sky.
She packed an apple and a banana as fruit for her lunch.
He used glue to stick the two pieces of paper together for his art project.
